import.name: Actor
import.description: Skilled at mimicry and dramatics

import.name: Alert
import.description: Always on the lookout for danger

import.name: Unarmored Defense
import.description: When no armor is equiped, you receive an AC of 10 + con + dex. This can be used with a shield.

import.name: Favored Enemy
import.description: You roll at an advantage when tracking (Survival) or recalling information (Intelligence) regarding a favored enemy.

import.name: Intimidating Pressence
import.description: Your pressence allows you to invoke fear in a creature

import.name: Thieves Cant
import.description: You can speak and read the special language of thieves.

import.name: SecondStory Work
import.description: You climb at 1.5 speed and have an advantage on saving throws resulting from jumping or falling.

import.name: Assassin's Kits
import.description: You can add your proficiency modifier to checks involving disguises or applying poison to weapons.

import.name: Arcane Trickster
import.description: You can cast magic as well as stab someone.

import.name: Hunter Initiate
import.description:
You may choose from one of the following feats:
+ Colossus Slayer
+ Giant Killer
+ Horde Breaker

import.name: Action Surge
import.description: You may use a charge to gain another action.

import.name: Sneak Attack
import.description:
Whenever you have advantage on an attack or an enemy is unaware of your pressence as you strike, you deal additional damage.

Only applies to attacks made with dexterity based weapons.

import.name: Natural Explorer
import.description: List terrain at which you are proficient at traveling. Every 5 levels a new terrain type can be selected.

import.name: Ice Mage
import.description: Your proficiency in ice gives you water resistence but fire vulnerability and access to special ice variants of water spells.

import.name: Fire Mage
import.description: Your proficiency in fire gives you fire resistence but water vulnerability and access to special fire spells.

import.name: Uncanny Dodge
import.description:
You can use your reactionary action to take half damage from a single target action being targeted at you.

Reactionary actions can be used once per round in response to another entity's actions.

import.name: Breath Weapon
import.description:
Grants a breath weapon spell.

Choose from: Acid Breath, Fire Breath, Ice Breath, Lightning Breath, or Necrotic Breath

import.name: Athlete
import.description: Additional training has imporved your strength and athletic ability

import.name: Rage
import.description: You can enter a frenzied rage that renders you immune to charm and imrpoves your physical combat, but removes your ability to cast spells.

import.name: Jack of All Trades
import.description:
Your travels have increased your prowess in all things life.

You can add half your proficiency modifier to any skill checks in which you are not already proficient.

import.name: Extra Attack
import.description:
If you use an action to attack, you can attack twice with that action.

If you are dual wielding, the first attack is your main hand, and the second is your off-hand.

import.name: Reckless Attack
import.description:
Your may opt to attack recklessly, abandoning concern for your safety. This gives you an advantage on the attack but all attacks against you have advantage until your next round.

You must decide to use this before you roll for attack.

import.name: Danger Sense
import.description: Your experience in combat has trained you to expect incoming danger. You gain an advantage on any dexterity saving throws as long as you are not blinded or deafened.

import.name: Fast Movement
import.description:
In your travels you've learned to squeeze even more speed in combat.

Only applies if you are not wearing any chest armor.

import.name: Dark Vision
import.description: Your vision in near pitch black is unhindered up to 30 studs away.

import.name: Mindless Rage
import.description: You may enter a mindless rage during which you can not be charmed or frightened in addition to the usual benefits of rage.

import.name: Aspect of the Wolf
import.description: You gain the senses of a wolf, increasing your balance and your sense of smell.

import.name: Spirit of the Wolf
import.description: While raging, your allies have advantage on melee attacks on any creature within 5 feet of you.

import.name: Spirit of the Bear
import.description: You can enter a feral rage that increases your resistance to all damage types except psychic.

import.name: Spirit of the Eagle
import.description:
While raging, enemies have a disadvantage on attacks of opportunity.
You additionally may use your bonus action to dash instead of needing a full action to move again.

import.name: Aspect of the Bear
import.description: Your carrying capacity is twice it's limit and you have an advantage on strength checks.

import.name: Aspect of the Eagle
import.description:
You can see clearly up to 1 mile away.

Additionally, dim lighting does not effect your perception.

import.name: Spirit Walker
import.description: Once per long rest, you can spend 1 hour communing with nature to summon your spirit animal. This animal will answer 3 questions within it's knowledge and within the knowledge of the environment where you are communing.

import.name: Cunning Action
import.description:
You can use your bonus action for one of 3 items:

+ Dash: Take your full movement again
+ Disengage: Remove the chance for an attack of opportunity from a target
+ Hide: Make a stealth check to become invisible to your enemies.

import.name: Fast Hands
import.description:
You can use your bonus action to perform  possible additional tasks:
+ A sleight of hand skill (ie. Pick a pocket, or Hide an object)
+ Use thieves tools to pick a lock or disarm a trap
+ Use an object (ie. Use a potion)

import.name: Assassinate
import.description:
You have advantage on attacks against creatures who have not yet performed "a combat action" (At the discretion of the DM).

In addition, if the attack hits, it deals damage as though it were a critical hit (Double all dice rolled).

import.name: Mage Hand Legerdemain
import.description: You are skilled with the use of Mage Hand and may opt to turn it invisible at will. Additionally, you can use it perform these additional Actions: + Stow an object in a container carried by a creature + Retrieve an object in a container carried by another creature + Use Thieves' Tools to pick a lock or disarm a trap

import.name: Giant Killer
import.description: Whenever a large or larger creature attacks you, whether it hits or misses, you may use your reactionary action to attack it.

import.name: Horde Breaker
import.description:
Once per turn when attacking, you may make an additional attack in the same action with the same weapon against another creature within 5 feet of your target.

You can not strike the same creature twice.

import.name: Keen Senses
import.description: You have advantage on perception checks.

import.name: Great Strength
import.description: Your great strength and combat training have honed your muscles. You can now wield two handed weapons without penalty.

import.name: Colossus Slayer
import.description: When attacking, you deal an additional 1d8 damage if the target is not at full health.

import.name: Beast Master
import.description:
You can find and befriend a beast to follow you and your companions into combat after several hours of concentrating and spending time with the animal.

Only one beast may follow you at a time.

This beast will follow your commands as best it can.

This creature's turn and actions are separate from your own.

Your companion levels with you and gains "(1d4/2) + con" when it level ups.

import.name: Magic Resistance
import.description: You have advantage on saving throws against magical effects.

import.name: Limited Telepathy
import.description: You can communicate basic ideas and imagery with any creature with whom you share a common language.

import.name: Pseudodragon
import.description: This is a pseudodragon

import.name: Blind Sight
import.description:
When you are blinded, you can sense other creatures within 5 studs of you, negating disadvantage on attacks.

This does not invalidate requirements were you must not be blinded.

import.name: High Elf
import.description:
Your high elvan ancestry helps you to handle magic and language.

You may add a feat of one language.

import.name: Mask of the Wild
import.description: You can attempt to hide even when you are only lightly obscured.

import.name: Superior Darkvision
import.description: You can see in near pitch black darkness out to 60 studs.

import.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
import.description: For attacks and vision based perception, you roll at a disadvantage if you or your target are in direct sunlight.

import.name: Wood Elf
import.description: Your keen senses and intuition serve you at every turn.

import.name: Dark Elf
import.description: Descended from an ancient and evil line of elves, darkness and magic serve you.

import.name: Gentlemanly
import.description: You exude an air of likability.

import.name: Stout
import.description: You have advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

import.name: Brave
import.description: You have advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

import.name: Lucky
import.description: Once per rest, you can reroll a "1" on an ability check or saving throw.

import.name: War Priest
import.description:
When you attack with a main action, you may use your bonus action to attack as well.

You can do this as many times per rest as your wisdom modifier.

For example; If you have a Wisdom modifier of 3, you may use this 3 times. Then if you take a short rest, you may use it another 3 times. Then if you take a long rest, you can use it another 3 times.

import.name: Channel Divinity
import.description:
You may channel the divinity of your god.

See your spells for divine channeling.

Track your remaining channels here.

Levels:
+ 1-6: 1 cast per rest
+ 7-17: 2 casts per rest
+ 18+: 3 casts

import.name: Avatar of Battle
import.description: The battlefield is your natural element.

import.name: Divine Strike
import.description: Once per turn, you may empower your strikes with divine energy, dealing extra damage. Every 14 levels the damage increases by 1d8 Radiant damage.

import.name: Versatile Trickster
import.description: Your mage hand counts towards flanking bonuses against enemies by drawing their attention.

import.name: Spell Thief
import.description:
As a reaction, you can for a creature casting a spell to pass a spell save against "8 + [Your Int Mod] + [Your Proficiency]".

On a failed save, the effects of the spell are cancelled, and if you are able to cast the spell, you know it for 8 hours.

You may cast "Spell Thief" once per long rest.

import.name: Thunderbolt Strike
import.description: When you deal lightning damage to a large creature or smaller, you can opt to push it up to 5 studs.

import.name: Stormborn
import.description:
You can now fly as a gentle hover.

You have a fly speed equal to your movement speed.

You are essentially similar in movement to an air elemental.

import.name: Tempest Cleric
import.description: The water is where you find your tranquility.

import.name: Tempest Cleric (3)
import.description: The water is where you find your tranquility.

import.name: Tempest Cleric (5)
import.description: The water is where you find your tranquility.

import.name: Keen Smell
import.description: You have an advantage on perception checks that rely on smell.

import.name: Flyby
import.description: You do not provoke attacks of opportunities when flying past enemies.

import.name: Web Walk
import.description: You can walk on spiderwebs unaffected by the slow.

import.name: Insect Climb
import.description: You can climb most surfaces at your normal movement speed.

import.name: Web Sense
import.description:
When in a web, you can sense and follow movement against it with pinpoint accuracy.

This bypasses any stealth or magical illusion.

import.name: Venomous
import.description:
Any successful attack requires the receiver to pass a DC 12 Constitution check or take poison damage.

Increases by 1d6 per 2 creature levels.

import.name: Small Spider
import.description: A small spider, less threatening than most but big enough to pose a threat.

import.name: Medium Spider
import.description: A fairly large spider but somewhat managable seeming.

import.name: Arcane Reduction
import.description: Resistance to most arcane damages.

import.name: Keen Hearing
import.description: You have an advantage on perception checks that rely on hearing.

import.name: Large Spider
import.description: A giant spider that poses a large threat.

import.name: Giant Spider
import.description: A very large spider that is quite imposing.

import.name: Kintari Servant of Insera
import.description: As a servant of Insera, you have learned to harness several fire abilities.

import.name: Archery
import.description:
You gain +2 attack when using ranged weaponry.

(You will have to add this manually at the moment)

import.name: Defense
import.description: While you are wearing chest armor, you gain +1 AC.

import.name: Dueling
import.description:
If you are using only 1 weapon, you deal an additional 2 damage.

(This must be done manually)

import.name: Two Weapon Fighting
import.description:
If you are using 2 weapons, you have +1 to your attack rolls.

(You must add this manually)

import.name: Conjurer
import.description: A wizard under the school of conjuration

import.name: Grim Harvester
import.description:
When a spell or summon you control lands the killing blow on a creature, you gain that spell's level times 2 in health.

If the spell or the spell that created the summon was a necromancy spell, gain the level times 3 instead.

import.name: Arcane Recovery
import.description:
During a short rest you may use a charge regain half your wizard level, rounded up, in spell slots.

For instance, if you are a level 3 (or level 4) wizard, you can regain 2 levels worth of spell slots as either 2 level 1 spells or 1 level 2 spell.

There is no limit to the level of the spell slot that can be recovered.

import.name: Focused Conjuration
import.description: While concentrating on a conjuration spell, damage can not interrupt your concentration.

import.name: Undead Thralls
import.description:
Whenever you use a spell to target a corpse or pile of bones, you may choose a second target with that spell at no additional cost.

Additionally, your summons that are the result of a necromancy spell gain your proficiency bonus when attacking.

Additionally, your summons that are the result of a necromancy spell gain your wizard level as additional hit points on their maximum.

import.name: Inured to Undeath
import.description: Your time studying the undead has rendered you normally immune to necrotic damage.

import.name: Minor Alchemy
import.description:
You can spend up to an hour transmuting a common substance such as wood or stone into another substance, including into the same substance.

For every 10 minutes spent concentrating on this spell, you can transmute a cubic stud of material.

The transmutation lasts up to 1 hour and requires concentration, but is minor enough to not interfere with normal spell concentration.

import.name: Transmuter's Stone Formation
import.description:
You can Create a Transmuter's Stone.

Upon creating a new Transmuter's Stone, the previously active Transmuter's Stone becomes inert.

import.name: Echolocation
import.description: You have blindsight out 30 studs as long as you can hear.

import.name: Amphibious
import.description: You can breathe in water and in air.

import.name: Underwater Breathing
import.description: You can only breathe underwater.

import.name: Keen Sight
import.description: You have an advantage on perception checks that use sight.

import.name: Minor Dark Vision
import.description: Your vision in near pitch black is unhindered up to 15 studs away.

import.name: Seafairing
import.description:
While amphibious, you prefer water.

Half speed while on land (Manual)

import.name: Seafairing
import.description:
While amphibious, you prefer water.

Half speed while on land (Manual)

import.name: Critical Advantage
import.description: If you have an advantage while striking and hit, your strike is guaranteed to critical.

import.name: Cleric of Knowledge
import.description: You value knowledge above all else, seeking to teach yourself and others more about the world than they knew the day before.

import.name: Stalker
import.description: You are supernaturally stealthy.

import.name: Sly Caster
import.description: You have an advantage when rolling stealth checks for casting magic.

import.name: Quickcast
import.description: Your understanding of magic allows you to cast minor spells with your bonus action.

import.name: Gnome Cunning
import.description: You have advantage on any magic related saving throws that are against Charisma, Wisdom, or Intelligence.

import.name: Speak with Small Beasts
import.description: Through sounds and gestures, you are able to perform basic communications with small beasts such as house cats, squirrels, rabbits, and small birds.

import.name: Forest Gnome Heritage
import.description:
Your heritage is that of a gnome of the forest.

You are friends with small animals but also are a bit secretive.

import.name: Spirit Barbarian
import.description: You follow the spirit of an animal to power your barbarian path.

import.name: Parry
import.description:
If you have a melee weapon equipped, you may use a reaction and a charge to parry when you are attacked once per round, adding 5AC to your stats against that attack.

You may opt to parry after you know if the attack will hit or not.

import.name: Minor True Sight
import.description: You immediately see through any visual illusions or magical deceptions that are cast below level 3, and have advantage on visual perception checks against magic.

import.name: Proficiency: Dexterity
import.description: You gain your proficiency bonus in dexterity checks.

import.name: Mute
import.description: Creature can't speak it's known languages verbally.

import.name: Animal Voice
import.description: Creature can't speak it's known languages verbally but can make noises.

import.name: Steady
import.description: You have advantage on saving throws that would knock you prone.

import.name: Undead Fortitude
import.description: When your health goes below 0, you make a constitution save of DC 5 + Lethal Damage and on a successful save, you drop to 1HP instead.

import.name: Blazing
import.description:
You are constantly on fire.

When hit with an attack, the attacker takes 1d4 damage in fire damage if the creature is within 3 studs.

If you are grappled, the grappler takes 1d4 damage at the start of their turn if they are still grappling you and at the start of grappling you.

import.name: Illumination
import.description: You are emitting light in a 20 stud radius.

import.name: Damage Link
import.description: Friendly creatures with this feat share damage.

import.name: Frost
import.description:
Your body is naturally cold with icicles forming on your body with the right conditions.

Any attempts to grapple you are met with 1d4 cold damage and if the creature continues to attempt to grapple you, it takes another 1d4 damage at the start of its turn.

You are additionally resilient to slashing and piercing damage and immune to cold.

import.name: Divine Sense
import.description:
The presence of strong evil registers on your senses like a noxious odor, and powerful good rings like heavenly music in your ears. As an action, you can open your awareness to detect such forces.

Until the end of your next turn, you know the location of any celestial, fiend, or undead within 30 studs of you that is not behind total cover. You know the type (celestial, fiend, or undead) of any being whose presence you sense, but not its identity (the vampire Count Strahd von Zarovich, for instance).

Within the same radius, you also detect the presence of any place or object that has been consecrated or desecrated, as with the hallow spell.

import.name: Lay on Hands
import.description:
Your blessed touch can heal wounds. You have a pool of healing power that replenishes when you take a long rest. With that pool, you can restore a total number of hit points equal to your paladin level Ã— 5. 

As an action, you can touch a creature and draw power from the pool to restore a number of hit points to that creature, up to the maximum amount remaining in your pool.

Alternatively, you can expend 5 hit points from your pool of healing to cure the target of one disease or neutralize one poison affecting it. You can cure multiple diseases and neutralize multiple poisons with a single use of Lay on Hands, expending hit points separately for each one.

For instance, to cure 2 diseases would require 1 use of Lay on Hands that expends 10 charges; 5 charges for the first disease and 5 charges for the second. Along the same lines, 2 diseases and 1 poison would cost 15 charges.

This feature has no effect on undead and constructs.

import.name: Paladin Style: Defense
import.description: As long as you are wearing a chest piece, you gain 1 additional armor.

import.name: Paladin Style: Great Weapon Fighting
import.description:
When you roll a 1 or 2 on a damage die for an attack you make with a melee weapon that you are wielding with two hands, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll.

The weapon must have the two-handed or versatile property for you to gain this benefit.

import.name: Paladin Style: Protection
import.description:
When a creature you can see attacks a target other than you that is within 5 feet of you, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll.

You must be wielding a shield.

import.name: Paladin Style: Dueling
import.description: When you are wielding a melee weapon in one hand and no other weapons, you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls with that weapon.

import.name: Divine Health
import.description:
The divine magic flowing through you has rendered you immune to diseases.

Diseases manifest as effects against you. Check with the Dungeon Master to make sure no disease effects are applied to you.

import.name: Aura of Protection
import.description:
Whenever you or a friendly creature
within 8 studs of you must make a saving throw, the creature gains a bonus to the saving throw equal to your Charisma modifier (with a minimum bonus of +1). 

You must be conscious to grant this bonus.

At 18th level, the range of this aura increases to 30 feet.

import.name: Oath of Devotion (dep)
import.description:
The Oath of Devotion binds a paladin to the loftiest ideals of justice, virtue, and order. Sometimes called cavaliers, white knights, or holy warriors, these paladins meet the ideal of the knight in shining armor, acting with honor in pursuit of justice and the greater good. They hold themselves to the highest standards of conduct, and some, for better or worse, hold the rest of the world to the same standards. Many who swear this oath are devoted to gods of law and good and use their godsâ€™ tenets as the measure of their devotion. They hold angelsâ€”the perfect servants of goodâ€”as their ideals, and incorporate images of angelic wings into their helmets or coats of arms.

# Tenets of Devotion
Though the exact words and strictures of the Oath of
Devotion vary, paladins of this oath share these tenets.

+ **Honesty**. Donâ€™t lie or cheat. Let your word be
your promise.

+ **Courage**. Never fear to act, though caution is wise. Compassion. Aid others, protect the weak, and punish those who threaten them. Show mercy to your foes, but temper it with wisdom.

+ **Honor**. Treat others with fairness, and let your honorable deeds be an example to them. Do as much good as possible while causing the least amount of harm.

+ **Duty**. Be responsible for your actions and their consequences, protect those entrusted to your care, and obey those who have just authority over you.

import.name: Oath of Devotion
import.description:
The Oath of Devotion binds a paladin to the loftiest ideals of justice, virtue, and order. Sometimes called cavaliers, white knights, or holy warriors, these paladins meet the ideal of the knight in shining armor, acting with honor in pursuit of justice and the greater good. They hold themselves to the highest standards of conduct, and some, for better or worse, hold the rest of the world to the same standards. Many who swear this oath are devoted to gods of law and good and use their godsâ€™ tenets as the measure of their devotion. They hold angelsâ€”the perfect servants of goodâ€”as their ideals, and incorporate images of angelic wings into their helmets or coats of arms.

# Tenets of Devotion
Though the exact words and strictures of the Oath of
Devotion vary, paladins of this oath share these tenets.

+ **Honesty**. Donâ€™t lie or cheat. Let your word be
your promise.

+ **Courage**. Never fear to act, though caution is wise. Compassion. Aid others, protect the weak, and punish those who threaten them. Show mercy to your foes, but temper it with wisdom.

+ **Honor**. Treat others with fairness, and let your honorable deeds be an example to them. Do as much good as possible while causing the least amount of harm.

+ **Duty**. Be responsible for your actions and their consequences, protect those entrusted to your care, and obey those who have just authority over you.

import.name: Oath Bound
import.description:
You are bound to the oaths you have taken and there are possible penalties for going against your oaths.

#Breaking Your Oath

A paladin tries to hold to the highest standards of conduct, but even the most virtuous paladin is fallible. Sometimes the right path proves too demanding, sometimes a situation calls for the lesser of two evils, and sometimes the heat of emotion causes a paladin to transgress his or her oath.

A paladin who has broken a vow typically seeks absolution from a cleric who shares his or her faith or from another paladin of the same order. The paladin might spend an all night vigil in prayer as a sign of penitence, or undertake a fast or similar act of self-denial. After a rite of confession and forgiveness, the paladin starts fresh.

If a paladin willfully violates his or her oath and shows no sign of repentance, the consequences can be more serious. At the DM's discretion, an impenitent paladin might be forced to abandon this class and adopt another, or perhaps to take the Oathbreaker paladin option that appears in the Dungeon Master's Guide.

import.name: Aura of Devotion
import.description:
You and friendly creatures within 8 studs of you canâ€™t be Charmed while you are conscious.

At 18th level, the range of this aura increases to 24 studs.

import.name: Oath of the Ancients
import.description:
The Oath of the Ancients is as old as the race of elves and the rituals of the druids. Sometimes called fey knights, green knights, or horned knights, paladins who swear this oath cast their lot with the side of the light in the cosm ic struggle against darkness because they love the beautiful and life-giving things of the world, not necessarily because they believe in principles of honor, courage, and justice. They adorn their arm or and clothing with images of growing thingsâ€”leaves, antlers, or flowersâ€”to reflect their commitment to preserving life and light in the world.

# Tenets of the Ancients

The tenets of the Oath of the Ancients have been preserved for uncounted centuries. This oath emphasizes the principles of good above any concerns of law or chaos. Its four central principles are simple.

+ **Kindle the Light**. Through your acts of mercy, kindness, and forgiveness, kindle the light of hope in the world, beating back despair.

+ **Shelter the Light**. Where there is good, beauty, love, and laughter in the world, stand against the wickedness that would swallow it. Where life flourishes, stand against the forces that would render it barren.

+ **Preserve Your Own Light**. Delight in song and laughter, in beauty and art. If you allow the light to die in your own heart, you canâ€™t preserve it in the world.

+ **Be the Light**. Be a glorious beacon for all who live in despair. Let the light of your joy and courage shine forth in all your deeds.

import.name: Aura of Warding
import.description:
Beginning at 7th level, ancient magic lies so heavily upon you that it forms an eldritch ward. You and friendly creatures within 8 studs of you take 50% damage from spells.

At 18th level, the range of this aura increases to 24 studs.

import.name: Relentless Avenger
import.description: Your supernatural focus helps you close off a foeâ€™s retreat. When you hit a creature with an opportunity attack, you can move up to half your speed immediately after the attack and as part of the same reaction. This movement doesnâ€™t provoke opportunity attacks.

import.name: Oath of Vengeance
import.description:
The Oath of Vengeance is a solemn commitment to punish those who have committed a grievous sin. When evil forces slaughter helpless villagers, when an entire people turns against the will of the gods, when a thievesâ€™ guild grow s too violent and powerful, when a dragon rampages through the countrysideâ€”at times like these, paladins arise and swear an Oath of Vengeance to set right that which has gone wrong. To these paladinsâ€”sometimes called avengers or dark knightsâ€”their own purity is not as important as delivering justice.

# Tenets of Vengeance
The tenets of the Oath of Vengeance vary by paladin, but all the tenets revolve around punishing wrongdoers by any means necessary. Paladins who uphold these tenets are willing to sacrifice even their own righteousness to mete out justice upon those who do evil, so the paladins are often neutral or lawful neutral in alignment. The core principles of the tenets are brutally simple.

+ **Fight the Greater Evil**. Faced with a choice of fighting my sworn foes or combating a lesser evil. I choose the greater evil.

+ **No Mercy for the Wicked**. Ordinary foes might win my mercy, but my sworn enemies do not.

+ **By Any Means Necessary**. My qualms canâ€™t get in the way of exterminating my foes.

+ **Restitution**. If my foes wreak ruin on the world, it is because I failed to stop them. I must help those harmed by their misdeeds.

import.name: Stout Resilience
import.description: You have advantage on saving throws against poison.

import.name: Ea's Spells
import.description: Ea's Spells

import.name: Frenzy
import.description:
You may go into a frenzy when you rage, allowing you to use your bonus action to attack.

This may be used once plus an addition once per long rest per 3 levels of barbarian.

ie. At level 3, you may frenzy twice and at level 6 you may frenzy 3 times before a long rest is needed.

import.name: Shelter of the Faithful
import.description:
As an acolyte, you command the respect of those who share your faith, and you can perform the religious ceremonies of your deity. You and your adventuring companions can expect to receive free healing and care at a temple, shrine, or other established presence of your faith, though you must provide any material components needed for spells. Those who share your religion will support you (but only you) at a modest lifestyle.

You might also have ties to a specific temple dedicated to your chosen deity or pantheon, and you have a residence there. This could be the temple where you used to serve, if you remain on good terms with it, or a temple where you have found a new home. While near your temple, you can call upon the priests for assistance, provided the assistance you ask for is not hazardous and you remain in good standing with your temple.

import.name: Background: Acolyte
import.description:
You have spent your life in the service of a temple to a specific god or pantheon of gods. You act as an intermediary between the realm of the holy and the mortal world, performing sacred rites and offering sacrifices in order to conduct worshipers into the presence of the divine. You are not necessarily a clericâ€”performing sacred rites is not the same thing as channeling divine power.

Choose a god, a pantheon of gods, or some other quasi-divine being, and work with your DM to detail the nature of your religious service.

**Additionally**:  
Choose two language proficiencies.

import.name: False Identity
import.description:
You have created a second identity that includes documentation, established acquaintances, and disguises that allow you to assume that persona.

Additionally, you can forge documents including official papers and personal letters, as long as you have seen an example of the kind of document or the handwriting you are trying to copy.

import.name: Criminal Contact
import.description: You have a fully trustworthy contact in the criminal underground that you are able to contact with some secrecy and know of common underground networks to get your contact information over long distances.

import.name: By Popular Demand
import.description:
You can always find a place to perform in cities.

Your skills lend to people recognizing you in cities where you have performed or by people who were there or in those cities depending on the number of performances you have held.

Note that performances take time, effort, and in some cases, money as well.

import.name: Rustic Hospitality
import.description:
The common people know your deeds for them, and those that don't generally find you trustworthy.

Commoners in the cities are more likely to help hide or protect you as long as you have not threatened them previously.

import.name: Guild Membership
import.description:
You are a member of one of the large artisan guilds listed below. These guilds wield large political power and you must pay 5GP a month to maintain your membership.

+ Cartography Guild
+ Enchantery Guild
+ Shipwright Guild
+ Alchemist Guild
+ Smithery Guild
+ Craftery Guild
+ Brewery Guild
+ Cookery Guild
+ Masonry Guild
+ Jewelry Guild
+ Pottery Guild

You can take note of this as a note for this Feat in your information.

import.name: Wanderer
import.description:
You have an excellent sense of your bearings and can easily recall maps and geography.

You can also easily find water or food in terrain that offers either.

import.name: Position of Privilege
import.description:
You are a noble from somewhere and have some connections and respect from that birthright.

Talk to the DM to workout your nobility.

import.name: Discovery
import.description:
In your exploration of the world, seeking your seclusion, you've discovered something relevant to the campaign of the world.

Work with the DM to determine what you've discovered based on your origins.

import.name: Resercher
import.description: When performing arcana, history, or religion checks, you often know where to find the answers if you can't recall the specifics that you seek.

import.name: Ship's Passage
import.description:
You've served on ships in the past and your knowledge of ships and sailing enables you to more easily secure passage on ships.

Your past crew or ship you served on may also help you for free or as a favor.

import.name: Military Rank
import.description:
You've served in an Army or Navy previously and still maintain a rank with that army.

Those soldiers still respect you and respond to your rank and reputation.

import.name: City Secrets
import.description:
You understand the flow of traffic in cities and can navigate them twice as fast.

You can also more easily persuade those on the streets to help you with gathering information.

import.name: Drink Mixing
import.description: Your skills at mixing drinks are able to help you make friends in some circles.

import.name: Barkeep
import.description: You've served as a barkeep in one or many taverns or brothels. You skills at mixing drinks are able to help you make friends in some circles.

import.name: Background: Barkeep
import.description:
You've served as a barkeep in one or many taverns or brothels and over the years you've managed to pick up on several languages.

In addition, choose the places where you've served as a barkeep.

**Additionally**:  
Choose two language proficiencies.

import.name: Background: Charlatan
import.description: You have always had a way with people. You know what makes them tick, you can tease out their heart' desires after a few minutes of conversation, and with a few leading questions you can read them easily. It's a useful talent, and you're quite willing to use it to your advantage.

import.name: Background: Criminal
import.description:
You are an experienced criminal with a history of breaking the law. You've spent a lot of time around other criminals and they may recognize you, which may help or hinder your efforts.

But you do manage to keep a contact in the underworld that you trust completely.

import.name: Background: Entertainer
import.description:
You're a skilled entertainer and can rouse almost any audience. You take pride in your work, and your performances are very important to you.

**Additionally**:  
Choose an instrument with which you are proficient and where you've performed before.

import.name: Background: Folk Hero
import.description: You came from humble social ranks, but you've proven to be destined for more as you stood up for the rights of those with whom you lived.

import.name: Background: Guild Artisan
import.description:
You are a member of one of the large artisan guilds listed below. These guilds wield large political power and you must pay 5GP a month to maintain your membership.

+ Cartography Guild
+ Enchantery Guild
+ Shipwright Guild
+ Alchemist Guild
+ Smithery Guild
+ Craftery Guild
+ Brewery Guild
+ Cookery Guild
+ Masonry Guild
+ Jewelry Guild
+ Pottery Guild

You can take note of this as a note for this Feat in your information.

**Additionally**:  
Choose one language proficiency.

import.name: Background: Hermit
import.description:
You avoid most large crowds of people and cities make you uncomfortable. You prefer the silence and serenity of the wilderness.

In your travels, you picked up on another language, using it to communicate with the few other inhabitants in the wilderness whom you knew.

**Additionally**:  
Choose one language proficiency.

import.name: Background: Noble
import.description:
You are of noble birth.

Determine the details of your nobility with the DM.

**Additionally**:  
Choose one language proficiency.

import.name: Background: Outlander
import.description:
You grew up in the wilderness, far from civilization. This remote upbringing has led to a love of traveling.

**Additionally**:  
Choose one language proficiency.

import.name: Background: Sage
import.description:
You can toil away hours learning about new subjects and following rogue trains of thought.

Choose a subject from the below on which you have read the most:  
+ Astronomy
+ Libraries
+ Alchemy
+ Masonry
+ Weather
+ Sailing

**Additionally**:  
Choose two language proficiencies.

import.name: Background: Sailor
import.description:
You've served on ships in the past and your knowledge of ships and sailing enables you to more easily secure passage on ships.

Your past crew or ship you served on may also help you for free or as a favor.

import.name: Background: Soldier
import.description:
You've served in an Army or Navy previously and still maintain a rank with that army.

Those soldiers still respect you and respond to your rank and reputation.

import.name: Background: Urchin
import.description:
You understand the flow of traffic in cities and can navigate them twice as fast.

You can also more easily persuade those on the streets to help you with gathering information.

import.name: Infernal Legacy
import.description:
Thanks to your heritage, you know the below spells. You may use a charge from your Infernal Legacy to cast any of the spells instead of using a spell slot (If you have one). However you must be the indicated level to do so.
+ (Any) Thaumaturgy
+ (3rd) Hellish Rebuke
+ (5th) Darkness

import.name: Stone Cunning
import.description:
When making history checks related to stone, you are considered proficient.

You add your ${"content":"Proficiency","class":"rs-orange"}$ (${pro,orange}$) Modifier to the ${"content":"History","class":"rs-orange"}$ roll.

import.name: Fey Ancestry
import.description: You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed and magic can not put you to sleep.

import.name: Trance
import.description:
You may choose to trance instead of sleeping, gaining the benefit of a full night's rest in 4 hours instead of 8.

If you trance in your armor, it instead takes 5 hours.

import.name: Halfling Nimbleness
import.description: You can move through the space of any creature that is of a size larger than yours and can squeeze through smaller holes.

import.name: Savage Attacks
import.description:
When you score a critical hit with a melee weapon attack, you can roll one of the weaponâ€™s damage dice one additional time and add it to the extra damage of the critical hit.

Note this is not doubled, merely added.

So on a critical with a 1d8 weapon;
1. You roll 1d8 > 4
2. It's a critical; Double the damage > 8
3. Roll another 1d8 for this feat > 2
4. Add the roll to the damage the critical would deal > 10

import.name: Relentless Endurance
import.description: When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. You canâ€™t use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

import.name: Hill Dwarf
import.description: As a hill dwarf, you have keen senses, deep intuition, and remarkable resilience. The gold dwarves of FaerÃ»n in their mighty southern kingdom are hill dwarves, as are the exiled Neidar and the debased Klar of Krynn in the Dragonlance setting.

import.name: Mountain Dwarf
import.description: As a mountain dwarf, youâ€™re strong and hardy, accustomed to a difficult life in rugged terrain. Youâ€™re probably on the tall side (for a dwarf), and tend toward lighter coloration. The shield dwarves of northern FaerÃ»n, as well as the ruling Hylar clan and the noble Daewar clan of Dragonlance, are mountain dwarves.

import.name: Rock Gnome Heritage
import.description: As a rock gnome, you have a natural inventiveness and hardiness beyond that of other gnomes. Most gnomes in the worlds of D&D are rock gnomes, including the tinker gnomes of the Dragonlance setting.

import.name: Artificerâ€™s Lore
import.description: Whenever you make a history check related to magic items, alchemical objects, or technological devices, you can add twice your proficiency bonus, instead of any proficiency bonus you normally apply.

import.name: Tinkerer
import.description:
You have proficiency with artisanâ€™s tools (tinkerâ€™s tools). Using those tools, you can spend 1 hour and 40 gp worth of materials to construct a Tiny clockwork device (AC 5, 1 hp). The device ceases to function after 24 hours (unless you spend 1 hour repairing it to keep the device functioning), or when you use your action to dismantle it; at that time, you can reclaim the materials used to create it. You can have up to three such devices active at a time.

When you create a device, choose one of the following options:

+ Clockwork Toy. This toy is a clockwork animal, monster, or person, such as a frog, mouse, bird, dragon, or soldier. When placed on the ground, the toy moves 5 studs across the ground on each of your turns in a random direction. It makes noises as appropriate to the creature it represents.

+ Fire Starter. The device produces a miniature flame, which you can use to light a candle, torch, or campfire. Using the device requires your action.

+ Music Box. When opened, this music box plays a single song at a moderate volume. 
The box stops playing when it reaches the songâ€™s end or when it is closed.

import.name: Naturally Stealthy
import.description: You can attempt to hide even when you are obscured only by a creature that is at least one size larger than you.

import.name: Stout
import.description: As a stout halfling, youâ€™re hardier than average and have some resistance to poison. Some say that stouts have dwarven blood. In the Forgotten Realms, these halflings are called stronghearts, and theyâ€™re most common in the south.

import.name: Lightfoot
import.description:
As a lightfoot halfling, you can easily hide from notice, even using other people as cover. Youâ€™re inclined to be affable and get along well with others. In the Forgotten Realms, lightfoot halflings have spread the farthest and thus are the most common variety.

Lightfoots are more prone to wanderlust than other halflings, and often dwell alongside other races or take up a nomadic life. In the world of Greyhawk, these halflings are called hairfeet or tallfellows.

import.name: Blindsense
import.description: You are aware of enemies auditorally

import.name: Meditative Defense
import.description:
When no armor, nor any shield, is equipped, you receive an AC of 10 + Dex (${dex,orange}$) + Wis (${wis,orange}$).

Note: Dex is normally included by default.

import.name: Feral Instinct
import.description: You are more aware than the average foe. If enemies surprise you, you act normally during their surprise round, provided you are not incapacitated.

import.name: Death Cleric
import.description: As a Cleric of the death domain, you are familiar with the process of creatures passing into the afterlife.

import.name: Reaper
import.description: When you cast a necromancy cantrip that normally targets only one creature, the spell can instead target two creatures within range and within 5 feet of each other.

import.name: Evasion
import.description:
You can nimbly dodge out of the way of areas of effect such as explosions or ice storms.

When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

There is no limit to the use of this feat.

import.name: Adaptive Armor
import.description:
When hit with any kind of magical damage, you become resistant to that damage type. When you take damage of that type, you reduce the damage by ${"class":"rs-orange","roll":"(con)d6"}$ 
 ( ${(con)d6}$ ).

Dispel Magic channeled through a power crystal that matches the color can remove a resistance.

import.name: Advanced Adaptive Armor
import.description:
When hit with any kind of magical damage, you become resistant to that damage type. When you take damage of that type, you reduce the damage by ${"class":"rs-orange","roll":"(con)d6"}$ .

You can be resistant to 2 damage types this way.

You glow a color in accordance with the damage type that you are resistant to.

Dispel Magic channeled through a power crystal that matches the color can remove a resistance.

import.name: Swallow
import.description: If successfully hit with a bite attack and not currently swallowing a creature, can attempt to eat the target with a Strength DC:${"class":"rs-orange","roll":"10 + str"}$. Creature's starting their turn inside the Wyrm take ${"class":"rs-orange", "content":"1d8"}$ Acid damage at the beginning of the round.

import.name: Great Weapon Master
import.description:
You may take -5 to your attack roll to add 10 damage to your hit (Of the damage type that deals the rolls the largest Dice).

You must decide to use this before you roll for attack.

import.name: Ki
import.description:
Your training allows you to harness the mystic energy of ki. Your access to this energy is represented by a number of ki points.

These points are used as part of some of your abilities.

import.name: Unarmored Movement
import.description:
You can move farther while you are not wearing armor or wielding a shield.

At Monk Level 9, you are able to run along angled surfaces without falling in any one continuous move on your turn. This does depend on the surface and your footwear.

import.name: Sorcery Points
import.description:
Sorcery points are another way to control spells in addition to your spell slot.

## Spell Slot to Sorcery Point
As a bonus action, you can expend a spell slot to gain sorcery points equal to that slots level.

For example, you may expend a level 3 spell slot to gain 3 sorcery points.

## Sorcery Point to Spell Slot

Additionally as a bonus action you may convert some number of sorcery points into a spell slot, but you can not create a slot that you would not have otherwise nor one above level 5.

Spell Slot creation cost:
1. 2 Points
2. 3 Points
3. 5 Points
4. 6 Points
5. 7 Points

## Resting

When finishing a long rest, your Sorcery Points and Spell slots revert to the usual refreshed counts.

import.name: Second Wind
import.description: You have a limited well of stamina that you can draw on to protect yourself from harm. On your turn, you can use a bonus action to regain hit points.

import.name: Servant of Dionysus
import.description: You have advantage on any saves involving alcohol.

import.name: Superior True Sight
import.description: You have advantage on any perception checks, regardless of if magic is involved or not and you succeed on any roll above a 1.

import.name: Soul Grafting
import.description:
After reading through ${Inquist,orange}$'s journal, you've learned to graft pieces of a body's past soul into your summons to grant any summon +${1,orange}$ to any of the below stats per corpse used to construct it.  
+ Strength
+ Dexterity
+ Constitution

import.name: Foresight of Souls
import.description:
After reading through ${Inquist,orange}$'s journal and some divine aid, you feel more intune with the wandering dead and can see through their eyes with enough will.

You may use a charge to reroll any ${Thieves,orange}$ ${Tools,orange}$ or ${Perception, orange}$ check.

import.name: Soul Strength
import.description:
Giving peace to the lost souls of the Esclau Commune left a few lingering on the plane, thankful for your strength. You feel their strength adding to your own.

You may use a charge after dealing damage with an attack to cleave through the creature you struck to deal the same amount of damage to another creature adjacent to your target.

import.name: Rock Burrowing
import.description: You have a natural ability to blend into rock as an action and then move at half speed while burrowed.

import.name: Legendary Resistance
import.description: You may use a charge to succeed a failed saving throw.

import.name: Acid Breath
import.description: You exhale acid in a 30-stud line that is 5 studs wide. Each creature in that line must make a DC${10+str,orange}$ Dexterity saving throw, taking 12d8 Acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

import.name: Black Dragon
import.description: You exhale acid in a 30-stud line that is 5 studs wide. Each creature in that line must make a DC${10+str,orange}$ Dexterity saving throw, taking 12d8 Acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

import.name: Soul Binder
import.description:
Studying cursed tombs and scrolls has instilled you with knowledge to manipulate the souls of the dead, allowing you to bind them to your summons and empower them with various effects.

The charges here track the number of souls you have at your disposal to work into your constructs.

Any construct can have ${pro + 1,orange}$ souls bound to it and each effect will indicate its soul cost.

import.name: Two-Handed Fighting
import.description: You are skilled with fighting using weapons in both hands, allowing your proficiency to be added to your off-hand.

import.name: Devil's Step
import.description:
You may use a charge to gain the effect ${"content":"Devil's Step","class":"rs-orange"}$.

Lasts ${10,orange}$ minutes but can be released at any time. While active, your eyes glow an evil red, you feel the pull of greed, and your footsteps are always quiet.

import.name: Strength of the Pack
import.description: As long as the alpha of your pack is within ${60,orange}$ studs of you, you can attack twice as a single action.

import.name: Strength of the Moon
import.description:
As long as the moon is out and you are outside, you deal an additional ${1,orange}$d${6,orange}$ ${Cold,orange}$ damage with every strike and have an additional reduction against ${Cold,orange}$ 
 damage of ${1,orange}$d${6,orange}$.

import.name: Masterful Parry
import.description:
Having studied the art of parrying and honing your senses in combat, you have mastered the ability to parry attacks.

If you have a melee weapon equipped, you may use a reaction and a charge to parry when you are attacked once per round, adding 5AC to your stats against that attack.

You may opt to parry after you know if the attack will hit or not.

import.name: Blue Crystalline Core
import.description: This creature has an elemental core similar to that of a power crystal, granting it chaotic and unknown abilities.

import.name: Red Crystalline Core
import.description: This creature has an elemental core similar to that of a power crystal, granting it chaotic and unknown abilities.

import.name: Green Crystalline Core
import.description: This creature has an elemental core similar to that of a power crystal, granting it chaotic and unknown abilities.

import.name: Orange Crystalline Core
import.description: This creature has an elemental core similar to that of a power crystal, granting it chaotic and unknown abilities.

import.name: Golden Crystalline Core
import.description: This creature has an elemental core similar to that of a power crystal, granting it chaotic and unknown abilities.

import.name: Silver Crystalline Core
import.description: This creature has an elemental core similar to that of a power crystal, granting it chaotic and unknown abilities.

import.name: Storm Ravager
import.description:
Your attunement with the storms allows you to further manipulate your opponents in battle.

You may use a charge to push any creature who has taken lightning damage ${2d4,orange}$ studs in any direction.

If the sky is visible and cloudy, you may add ${1d4,orange}$ of ${"content":"Thunder","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ damage. If a thunderstorm is above you, it is ${1d12,orange}$ instead.

This feat can have as many charges as your ${"content":"Wisdom","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ modifier.

import.name: Storm's Thunder
import.description:
Blessed by the thunderous power of the seas, your strength grows.

You find you can use 1 charge on a successful attack to attempt an attack on another creature near your target, your might cleaving through your enemies.

This feat has a maximum number of charges equal to your ${"content":"Strength","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ modifier.

import.name: Storm's Light
import.description:
Blessed by the storm's of the sea, your body tingles with energy.

You may use a charge to add ${1d4,orange}$ to any ${"content":"Charisma","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ or ${"content":"Wisdom","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ save (At most once per save) or gain ${"content":"Dark Vision","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ for 5 minutes, allowing you to see 30 studs in the dark.

This feat has a maximum number of charges equal to your ${"content":"Charisma","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ modifier.

import.name: Storm's Grace
import.description:
Blessed by the storm's of the sea, your hands are more nimble.

You may use a charge to add ${1d4,orange}$ to any of the below rolls:
+ Any attack roll with your offhand (Before you know if you will hit)
+ Sleight of Hand Checks

You can use at most one charge per check.

This feat has a maximum number of charges equal to your ${"content":"Dexterity","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ modifier.

import.name: Storm's Fortitude
import.description:
Blessed by the storms of the sea, your body feels more durable.

You may use a charge to add ${1d4,orange}$ to a ${"content":"Constitution","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ save or a ${"content":"Concentration","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ check, using at most 1 charge per check or save.

Additionally, a charge may be used to reduce ${"content":"Bludgeoning","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, ${"content":"Crushing","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, or ${"content":"Force","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ damage by ${1d4,orange}$.

This feat has a maximum number of charges equal to your ${"content":"Constitution","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ modifier.

import.name: Storm's Knowledge
import.description:
Blessed by the storms of the sea, you feel the knowledge of your mind deepen.

You may use a charge to add ${1d4,orange}$ to an ${"content":"Arcana","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, ${"content":"History","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, or ${"content":"Nature","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ check, using at most 1 charge per check.

This feat has a maximum number of charges equal to your ${"content":"Intelligence","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ modifier.

import.name: Reach
import.description: When attacking, you can attack creatures up to 4 additional studs away.

import.name: Sting
import.description:
Sting a target dealing poison damage.

If the target takes any poison damage, they perform a ${Constitution,orange}$ save at DC${5,orange}$. If failed, the target is rendered unconscious until it takes damage or is woken by someone.

import.name: Improved Familiar
import.description:
You've become aware of new and improved forms for your familiar to take. These forms are more powerful, but also larger, giving your familiar more versatility.

And while there are many possibilities, the forms your familiar can take are still limited by your knowledge and arcane abilities.

See your knowledge of ${"content":"Improved Familiar Forms","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ for the new forms you know of for your familiar.

import.name: Divine Infusion
import.description: you

import.name: Improved Critical
import.description:
Your knowledge of weaknesses has been honed.

When striking a creature, you may use a 
 number of charges to lower the value needed to critical achieve a critical hit.
+ ${1,orange}$ Charge: Critical on ${19,orange}$
+ ${8,orange}$ Charges: Critical on ${18,orange}$

While this lowers the critical range, it does not guarantee that you hit, your total value must still exceed the target's ${"content":"Armor","class":"rs-orange"}$.

The maximum number of charge for this is twice your ${"content":"Dex","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ Modifier (${dex,orange}$).

import.name: Step Softly
import.description:
Clarity of mind helps you to move softly through the world and you've learned of several meditative techniques that can help.

You may use a charge to meditate. Make a ${Constitution,orange}$ or ${Wisdom,orange}$ save at DC${20,orange}$. On success, you have advantage on ${Stealth,orange}$ checks for the next 24 hours or until your next long rest.

Alternatively, you may use the charge to quickly focus and use your new found discipline to automatically succeed one ${Stealth,orange}$ check, even if you have already rolled, allowing you to recover from possible failure.

And should you want to save it for a critical turning point, you may use the charge to attack an enemy who has not seen you to automatically hit and automatically critical to deal double damage.

import.name: Divine Attunement
import.description:
Your equipped ${"content":"Holy Symbol","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ can temporarily gain the effects of any attuned items in your possession.

At anytime you may use a charge to trigger the effect from another item with your symbol, regardless of it is equipped or not.

the maximum number of charge for this is twice your wisdom modifier.

Alternatively, you may ${"content":"Channel Divinity","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ to gain the effect of an attuned item for 1 hour.

Only ${2,orange}$ attunement effects may be active through this feat at a time.

import.name: Wallwalk
import.description: You are able to walk on walls.

import.name: Huntress
import.description:
Studying your opponents, you can gain advantages against them.

You may perform an ${Investigation,orange}$ check against a creature to study it. Out of combat you may make several checks to flush out your familiarity. In combat, this uses your ${Action,orange}$ and may not make you familiar enough with the creature. On a high enough ${Investigation,orange}$ roll, the target performs a ${Wisdom,orange}$ save at DC${wis+10,orange}$ and if failed, you are familiar enough with the creature's habits.

You can use a charge to cover a variety of tasks for procuring your prey, but they only work against one that has been studied;
+ Advantage on ${Perception,orange}$ checks when attempting to find or follow the creature
+ Advantage on ${Stealth,orange}$ checks to hide from the creature
+ Advantage on ${"content":"Attacks","class":"rs-orange"}$ against the creature (Allows ${"content":"Sneak Attack","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ to trigger).
+ Advantage when saving against any spell or effect from the creature

However, these tasks strain your mind and are thus limited by your ${Wisdom,orange}$. This feat has charges equal to 2 plus your ${Wisdom,orange}$ modifier (${wis,orange}$).

import.name: Thrall
import.description: The wizard who summoned this undead creature had the ${"content":"Undead Thrall","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ feat, improving the performance of this summon.

import.name: Brutal Critical
import.description:
When you land a critical hit with a melee weapon, you roll an additional ${(barbarian-9)/4 + 1,orange}$ ${"content":"Weapon Dice","class":"rs-darkorange"}$.

The weapon's dice is determined by whichever dice applies ${Slashing,orange}$, ${Crushing,orange}$, ${Bludgeoning,orange}$, or ${Piercing,orange}$ damage and you take the largest dice of those.


Does not count for thrown melee weapons.

import.name: Infiltration Expertise
import.description:
You may spend your ${"content":"Wisdom Modifier","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ + 4 (${4+wis,orange}$) days preparing an alternative identity of a location for which you know the laws and customs, likely requiring you to have been there before or to research in a library.

Each day you perform a ${Thieves,orange}$ ${Tool's,orange}$ check and the summation of the ability checks determine the quality of your identity.

For creating a normal civilian identity, your identity is guaranteed to withstand any scrutiny unless the person looking has been given some reason to suspect you, then your quality will become important.

For creating a slightly well off identity, you will garner some respect from lower officials when interacting, but the identity will be subject to more initial scrutiny and may not hold.

For creating someone of royalty or other high affairs, your identity will need to be pristine and will likely see a great deal of scrutiny. You will likely need some kind of support structure to assist with this level of identity and will likely depend on  with whom you are interacting.

You can not spend additional time on the identity to add to it further, but you can start over.

Additionally you can have multiple identities prepared and ready (Their papers will exist as items in your ${"content":"Inventory","class":"rs-darkorange"}$), however each will have noticeable weight for the historical documents needed to prove your identify and without additional attention, you expect the documents to expire over time.

# Assumed levels of Scrutiny
Below is a basic guidelines of the levels of scrutiny at which you expect your identity to pass.

## For a Civilian:
+ Quality ${0,orange}$: Pass basic guards and checkpoints
+ Quality ${20,orange}$: Imprisoned as your false identity
+ Quality ${30,orange}$: Enter public regal affairs that have higher background checks
+ Quality ${50,orange}$: In-person meetings with royalty as your identity

## For a Well-Off Citizen
+ Quality ${30,orange}$: Pass basic guards and checkpoints
+ Quality ${60,orange}$: Imprisoned as your false identity
+ Quality ${100,orange}$: Enter public regal affairs that have higher background checks
+ Quality ${150,orange}$: In-person meetings with royalty as your identity

## For a Royal
+ Quality ${150,orange}$: Pass basic guards and checkpoints
+ Quality ${200,orange}$: Imprisoned as your false identity
+ Quality ${300+,orange}$: Enter public regal affairs that have higher background checks
+ Quality ${?,orange}$: In-person meetings with royalty as your identity

import.name: Supreme Sneak
import.description: You have advantages on ${Stealth,orange}$ checks and when using the ${Hide,orange}$ Action if you have not used any ${Movement,orange}$ that round.

import.name: Dual Wielding
import.description:
Having trained rigorously in combat with two weapons, you now gain the following benefits:
+ When wielding separate weapons in each hand, you gain ${1,darkorange}$ Armor
+ You may sue your ${"content":"Bonus Action","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ to make attacks with weapons that are not considered light

import.name: Mobile
import.description:
You are exceptionally speedy and agile. You gain the following benefits:
+ Your speed increases by your ${"content":"Dex","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ Modifier (${dex,orange}$)
+ When you use your action to ${"content":"Dash","class":"rs-orange"}$, difficult terrain doesnâ€™t cost you extra movement for the rest of your turn.
+ When you make a melee attack against a creature, you may expend a charge to force the creature into a defensive state where it can not take an attack of opportunity.
+ You may expend ${2,orange}$ additional charges after the first to consume a ${"content":"Reaction","class":"rs-orange"}$ from that creature. This can be repeated to consume multiple reactions.

Can hold charges equal to your ${"content":"Dex","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ Modifier (${dex,orange}$).

import.name: Compensatory Healer
import.description: When a friendly creature within ${20,orange}$ studs of you is injured by a hostile creature's actions, you may use a charge and a Reaction to cast a Healing Spell (Any spell that restores HP) of Level ${2,orange}$ or lower. That spell that must at least target the creature that was injured, but can target additional creatures as well. Can hold charges equal to your ${"content":"Wis","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ Modifier (${wis,orange}$).

import.name: Sigil Weaver
import.description: Your understanding of the arcane has expanded to allow you to improve the way in which you cast spells. When casting, you may expend a charge while casting a spell of Level ${int/3,orange}$ or lower (Excluding ${"content":"Cantrips","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ and scaling with your Intelligence Modifier (${int,orange}$)) as a ${"content":"Bonus Action","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ instead of as an ${"content":"Action","class":"rs-darkorange"}$. The spell additionally has a ${"content":"Somatic","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ (Hand Gesture) component even if it did not before. You still consume a ${"content":"Spell Slot","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ and perform all other parts of the spell as normal. Can hold charges equal to your ${"content":"Int","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ Modifier (${int,orange}$).

import.name: Sense Friend
import.description:
Keen scent markings allow you to mark friends, creating a unique scent that is difficult to recreate and allows for a rudimentary way of confirming a known identity.

However, any marked creature receives ${-4,orange}$ on any ${"content":"Stealth","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ checks.

It is possible that with some training, this stealth issue may be reduced, but will likely always be present...

import.name: Feline Fancier
import.description:
You fancy cats.

While you enjoy their pressence, they seem to generally avoid you, many seemingly put off by your attention to them.

import.name: Dog Devotee
import.description:
You greatly prefer dogs.

Not a fan of cats, they unnerve you in many situations. But you love dogs and may occasionally be distracted by the pressence of one.

import.name: Animal Chat
import.description: You can speak with many peaceful animals, but the communication is quite basic. Complex thoughts not being a property of animals, but thy can communicate simple ideas and direction, but things like "counts" do not exist.

import.name: Walk on Water
import.description: You can walk on water

import.name: Whelm
import.description: Each creature in the elementalâ€™s space must make a DC${10+str,orange}$ Strength saving throw. On a failure, a target takes ${2d8 + 4,orange}$ Bludgeoning damage. If it is Large or smaller, it is also grappled (Escape DC${10+str-1,orange}$). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained and unable to breathe unless it can breathe water. If the saving throw is successful, the target is pushed out of the elementalâ€™s space. The elemental can grapple one large creature or up to two Medium or smaller creatures at one time. At the start of each of the elementalâ€™s turns, each target grappled by it takes ${2d8 + 4,orange}$ Bludgeoning damage. A creature within 5 feet of the elemental can pull out a creature or object out of it by taking an action to make a DC${14,orange}$ Strength and succeeding.

import.name: Deadly Agility
import.description: As long as you are able to move, your fists do an extra 2 Bludgeoning damage and you may use a charge to gain ${1d6,orange}$ additional damage reduction against Bludgeoning, Slashing, or Piercing damage. This does not require any kind of action.

import.name: Water Form
import.description: The elemental can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

import.name: Fire Form
import.description: Can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. A creature that touches you or hits you with a melee Attack while within 4 studs of it takes 1d10 Fire damage. In addition, you can enter a Hostile creature's space and stop there. The first time it enters a creature's space on a turn, that creature takes 1d10 Fire damage and catches fire. Until someone takes an action to douse the fire, the creature takes 1d10 Fire damage at the start of each of its turns. Additionally, when struck by fire, you heal ${1d12,orange}$HP up to the damage taken.

import.name: Water Susceptibility
import.description: For every 1 studs moved in water, or for every Brick of water splashed on you, you take 1 cold damage.

import.name: Siege Monster
import.description: You double the final total of any damage dealt to objects or structures.

import.name: Earth Glide
import.description: You can burrow through nonmagical, unworked earth and stone. While doing so, you do not disturb the material through which you are moving. You move at a rate of ${15 + wis,orange}$ studs per round through the material. Effected by your Wisdom modifier.

import.name: Air Form
import.description: You can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. You can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

import.name: Ice Form
import.description: The area around you is blisteringly cold, resulting in all creatures within ${5,studs}$ taking 1d8 Cold damage when they move or take an action near you.

import.name: Split Vision
import.description: Having more than one head, you are able to track more creatures around you. It takes ${3+wis,orange}$ (Based on Wisdom) creatures for you to be considered Flanked, granting advantage on attacks against you.

import.name: Aware Vision
import.description: You are able to sense hostile creatures in your pressence and as long as your Wisdom is above ${12,orange}$ you can not be considered Flanked. Thus no creatures near you get advantage on attacks against you from there being hostile creatures adjacent to you.

import.name: Craft: Alchemist
import.description: You've researched alchemy for some time and honed your skills in the general craft of creating potions and elixirs. At some point you'll need to choose where to hone your skills, picking a specialization: + Abjuration (Protective) + Evocation (Destructive) + Transmutation (Altering) + Illusion (Obscuring) + Enchantment (Buffing)

import.name: Craft: Enchanter
import.description: You've researched enchanting for some time and honed your skills in the general craft of imbuing objects with magical properties. At some point you'll need to choose where to hone your skills, picking a specialization: + Abjuration (Protective) + Evocation (Destructive) + Transmutation (Altering) + Illusion (Obscuring) + Conjuration (Summoning)

import.name: Draconic Ancestry: Brass
import.description: As magic flows through your body, it causes physical traits of your dragon ancestors to emerge, granting you bonus health. When not wearing any chest armor, you gain an additional ${3,orange}$AC from your scales. Additionally, when speaking with dragons, you may have additionally bonuses to Persuasion, Deception, or Performance that could be up to half your proficiency bonus (${pro/2,orange}$).

import.name: Draconic Ancestry: Elemental Affinity
import.description: As a Brass Scaled Draconic Sorcerer, you have affinity for Fire. Any spells you cast that deal that damage type receive your Charisma Modifier (${cha,orange}$) as additional damage of that type (This addition must be done manually). Additionally, you may spend ${1,orange}$ Sorcery Point to gain an additional ${50,orange}$% reduction from that damage type.

import.name: Draconic Ancestry: Brass Elemental Affinity
import.description: As a Brass Scaled Draconic Sorcerer, you have affinity for Fire. Any spells you cast that deal that damage type receive your Charisma Modifier (${cha,orange}$) as additional damage of that type (This addition must be done manually). Additionally, you may spend ${1,orange}$ Sorcery Point to gain an additional ${50,orange}$% reduction from that damage type as part of casting that spell for 1 hour.

import.name: Draconic Ancestry: Dragon Wings
import.description: As a Bonus Action you can summon and dismiss Dragon Wings from your back that allow you to fly and last until dismissed. Summoning the wings while wearing chest armor not suited for them will either prevent the wings from summoning or cause the chest piece or clothing to be damaged or destroyed. Add the Draconic Dragon Wings Effect to track your wings.

import.name: Metamagic: Careful Spell
import.description: When you Cast a Spell that forces other creatures to make a saving throw, you can protect some of those creatures from the spellâ€™s full force. To do so, you spend ${1,orange}$ Sorcery Point and choose a number of those creatures up to your Charisma Modifier (${cha,orange}$). A chosen creature automatically succeeds on its saving throw against the spell.

import.name: Metamagic: Distant Spell
import.description: When you Cast a Spell that has a range of ${3,orange}$ studs or greater, you can spend ${1,orange}$ Sorcery Point to double the range of the spell. When you Cast a Spell that has a range of Touch, you can spend ${1,orange}$ Sorcery Point to make the range of the spell ${15,orange}$ studs.

import.name: Metamagic: Empowered Spell
import.description: When you roll damage for a spell, you can spend ${1,orange}$ Sorcery Point to reroll a number of the damage dice up to your Charisma Modifier (${cha,orange}$). You must use the new rolls. You can use this feat even if you have already used a different Metamagic option during the casting of the spell.

import.name: Metamagic: Extended Spell
import.description: When you Cast a Spell that has a Duration of ${1,orange}$ minute or longer, you can spend ${1,orange}$ Sorcery Point to double its Duration, to a maximum Duration of ${24,orange}$ hours.

import.name: Metamagic: Heightened Spell
import.description: When you Cast a Spell that forces a creature to make a saving throw to resist its effects, you can spend ${3,orange}$ Sorcery Point to give one target of the spell disadvantage on its first saving throw made against the spell.

import.name: Metamagic: Quickened Spell
import.description: When you Cast a Spell that has a Casting Time of ${1,orange}$ Action, you can spend ${2,orange}$ Sorcery Point to change the Casting Time to ${1,orange}$ Bonus Action for this casting. If your Action is used to cast a non-cantrip Spell, then you can only quicken a Cantrip.

import.name: Metamagic: Subtle Spell
import.description: When you Cast a Spell, you can spend ${1,orange}$ Sorcery Point to cast it without any Somatic or Verbal components. This can remove both components if desired.

import.name: Metamagic: Twinned Spell
import.description: When you Cast a Spell that Targets only one creature and doesnâ€™t have a range of self, you can spend a number of Sorcery Point equal to the spellâ€™s level to target a second creature in range with the same spell (${1,orange}$ Sorcery Point if the spell is a cantrip). To be eligible, a spell must be incapable of targeting more than one creature at the spellâ€™s current level. For example, Magic Missile and Scorching Ray arenâ€™t eligible, but Ray of Frost and Chaos Bolt are eligible.

import.name: Imposing
import.description:
You may choose to allow an adjacent creature to use you as an obstruction. When a creature attacks the obstructed creature, it has +${5,orange}$ AC.

However, if the attack misses, it hits you if more than a ${5,orange}$ is rolled.

import.name: Craft: Smithy
import.description: You've researched the construction of items and other goods for some time and honed your skills in the general craft of creating objects and structures. At some point you'll need to choose where to hone your skills, picking a specialization: + Weapons + Armor + Jewelery + Charms

import.name: Violent Apparition
import.description: Being touched by or touching this creature results in ${8 + str,orange}$d8 Necrotic damage. A creature performs a Constitution save to take half damage on success.

import.name: Chained Apparition
import.description: This apparition is draped in chains and capable of throwing a chain out to ${30,orange}$ studs, dealing 2d8 Bludgeoning damage. On hit, a charge can be expelled to Restrain the target or to explode for an additional 4d10 Necrotic damage. Once a creature is restrained, an Action can be used to compel that creature. The target makes a Wisdom save. Can have at most ${1 + wis,orange}$ creatures chained at once.

import.name: Ethereal Sight
import.description: When this creature is in a realm adjacent to the Ethereal Plane, such as The Material Plane, or Reykurax, it can see up to ${40,orange}$ studs into the Ethereal Plane. Additionally, while in the Ethereal Plane or its native plane, it has near perfect sight over ${60,orange}$ studs. You are only considered flanked when surrounded by more than 2 + Your Wisdom Modifier creatures (${2 + wis,orange}$ Creatures).

import.name: Ethereal Travel
import.description: This creature may travel in and out of the Ethereal Plane as part of its movement, by may only travel back to the plane from which it originated as part of its movement. ${1,orange}$ hour may be spent focusing on a single spot while in the Ethereal Plane to transition to that plane and then be able to move into another plane, anchoring the creature to the new plane.

import.name: Wraith Claws
import.description: Possessing vicious ghostly claws.

import.name: Chilling Touch
import.description: When you touch a living creature, your cold essence is harmful. Creatures harmed this way are cursed with the Chilled Soul Effect and receive half-healing for 1 minute. The target makes a Constitution save and on success takes half damage and does not suffer half healing.
