import.name: Incorporeal Walk
import.description: Your movement is unhindered by walls and other constructs or creatures.

import.name: Flaming Paws
import.description: As an action, you are able to strike with your claws.

import.name: Pack Tactics
import.description: You have advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the your allies is within 3 studs of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

import.name: Arcform
import.description: Your body is covered with arcing lightning that leaps out towards creatures near you and as you move, small clouds bristling with electricity shed off of your form. Any creature within ${8,orange}$ studs of you must make a Dexterity save when you or they become that close. They take 3d6 Lightning and 3d6 Necrotic damage or half as much on a successful save. The small clouds left in your wake are shed every 8 studs and last for 1d6 turns. Any creatures that start their turn within ${4,orange}$ studs of a cloud take 2d4 Lightning damage. When the cloud expires, it erupts, dealing 6d4 Lightning damage to all creatures within ${6,orange}$ studs of the cloud.

import.name: Charged Apparition
import.description: Your body is covered with arcing lightning that leaps out towards creatures near you and as you move, small clouds bristling with electricity shed off of your form. Any creature within ${4,orange}$ studs of you must make a Dexterity save when you or they become that close. They take 3d6 Lightning and 3d6 Necrotic damage or half as much on a successful save. The small clouds left in your wake are shed every 8 studs and last for 1d6 turns. Any creatures that start their turn within ${4,orange}$ studs of a cloud take 2d4 Lightning damage. When the cloud expires, it erupts, dealing 6d4 Lightning damage to all creatures within ${6,orange}$ studs of the cloud.

import.name: Vengeful Apparition
import.description: When you suffer any damage, the creature that struck you takes 1d6 Necrotic damage. A charge can be used to echo all damage received back to the creature attacking you as Necrotic damage. On death, you deal your max HP in Necrotic damage to all creatures within ${5,orange}$ studs of your body.

import.name: Foretold Future
import.description: When using a Divination Kit or Tarot Deck, you may expend a charge and perform an Arcana check to reveal the true nature of the future of a person or thing. ...[TODO]

import.name: Thorny
import.description: Any creature near or restrained by you suffers 1d4 Piercing and another 1d4 Acid damage.

import.name: Referri Petal Magical Consumption
import.description: May use a charge to consume the effect of a near-by or incoming magical ability. This effect can heal depending on the magic.

import.name: Flowering
import.description: May grow Referri Flowers whose petals are known to absorb magic. These flowers can be Hedged, each flower having an ${10+dex,orange}$AC and ${10+con,orange}$HP.

import.name: Ancient Diviner
import.description: When using a Divintation Kit or reading Tarot Cards, you may seek out objects that you are only passingly familiar with, provided they are unique and you know their true name, or gain information regarding a creature or object's location or future. Each read will take a toll on you. When no charge is used, you will be restricted to the normal limitations. However should you use a charge to reach beyond the normal limitations, you may find that additional charges are needed, either optional or required, to obtain further information. After a charge is used, you may exceed the number of charges you have remaining suffering 5d10 Psychic damage for every charge used that you do not posess. Your charge maximum is derived from your Wisdom (${wis,orange}$) modifier, and is the result of it times ${3,orange}$ (=${wis*3,orange}$).

import.name: Apparition
import.description:
Physical weapons have no effect on you unless they're silvered.

In addition, you heal for each point of necrotic damage taken.

import.name: Ancient Golem Funeral Golem
import.description: An ancient stone Golem enchanted for protecting an ancient burial site.

import.name: Retaliation
import.description: When a friendly creature within ${5,orange}$ studs of you is struck and you are holding a melee weapon, you may use a charge and perform an attack against the creature that performed the attack.

import.name: Awareness
import.description: You are not considered flanked until you are surrounded by 3 + Your Wisdom Modifier creatures (${3 + wis,orange}$).

import.name: Mob Multiattack
import.description: This animal can attack twice on its turn. Usually with a bite (piercing) and claws (slashing), however it has no bonus actions and may not be able to perform more complex actions such as pressing switches. See creature information for more details.

import.name: Aggress
import.description: You may move your full movement towards a creature of your choice that you are actively engaging or are planning to engage as a Bonus Action. You must end your turn closer to the chosen creature than when you took this action.

import.name: Focused Strike
import.description:
You choose a ${4,orange}$ stud square area, and on the next turn you strike there. Any creatures present are automatically considered struck and your hit is a guaranteed critical hit.

You keep your movement and bonus action for the turn on which you strike, but have no main action that round.

import.name: Divine Conduit
import.description: Your connection to your god can not be disturbed and you are in high standing with them.

import.name: Symphonic
import.description: You are wearing and attuned with a Symphonic item that shares damage with other bearer's of this effect.

import.name: Protection
import.description: When a creature you can see attacks a target other than you that is adjacent to you, you can use your Reaction to impose Disadvantage on the Attack roll. You must be wielding a Shield to perform this.

import.name: Hide in Plain Sight
import.description: You can spend 1 minute creating camouflage for yourself. You must have access to fresh mud, dirt, plants, soot, and other naturally occurring materials with which to create your camouflage. Once you are camouflaged in this way, you can try to hide by pressing yourself up against a solid surface, such as a tree or wall, that is at least as tall and wide as you are. You gain a +10 Stealth checks as long as you remain there without moving or taking actions. Once you move, take an action, or a reaction, then you must camouflage yourself again to gain this benefit.

import.name: Land's Stride
import.description:
Moving through non-magical difficult terrain costs you no extra movement. You can also pass through non-magical plants without being slowed by them and without taking damage from them if they have thorns, spines, or a similar hazard.

In addition, you have advantage on saving throws against plants that are magically created or manipulated to impede movement, such as those created by the entangle spell.

import.name: Escape the Horde
import.description: Attacks of Opportunity against you are made with Disadvantage.

import.name: Magical Secrets
import.description:
You've plundered magical knowledge from a wide spectrum of disciplines.

Your knowledge of spells has improved to allow you to know 2 additional spells.

import.name: Bardic Inspiration
import.description: You can inspire others through stirring words or music. To do so, you use a bonus action on your turn to choose one creature other than yourself within 30 studs of you (possibly further depending on the instrument used) who can hear you. That creature gains one Bardic Inspiration Die, a d6. Once within the next 10 minutes, the creature can roll the die and add the number rolled to one ability check, attack roll, or saving throw it makes. The creature can wait until after it rolls the d20 before deciding to use the Bardic Inspiration Die, but must decide before the DM says whether the roll succeeds or fails. Once the Bardic Inspiration Die is rolled, it is lost. A creature can have only one Bardic Inspiration Die at a time. Your Bardic Inspiration Die changes when you reach certain levels as a Bard. + Level 5: d8 + Level 10: d10 + Level 15: d12

import.name: Bardic Inspiration
import.description: You can inspire others through stirring words or music. To do so, you use a bonus action on your turn to choose one creature other than yourself within 30 studs of you (possibly further depending on the instrument used) who can hear you. That creature gains one Bardic Inspiration Die, a d6. Once within the next 10 minutes, the creature can roll the die and add the number rolled to one ability check, attack roll, or saving throw it makes. The creature can wait until after it rolls the d20 before deciding to use the Bardic Inspiration Die, but must decide before the DM says whether the roll succeeds or fails. Once the Bardic Inspiration Die is rolled, it is lost. A creature can have only one Bardic Inspiration Die at a time. Your Bardic Inspiration Die changes when you reach certain levels as a Bard. + Level 5: d8 + Level 10: d10 + Level 15: d12

import.name: Cutting Words
import.description: You have learned to use your wit to distract, confuse, and otherwise sap the confidence and competence of others. When a creature that you can see within 40 studs of you makes an attack roll, ability check, or a damage roll, you can use your Reaction to expend one of your uses of Bardic Inspiration, rolling a Bardic Inspiration Die and subtracting the number rolled from the creatureâ€™s roll. You can choose to use this feature after the creature makes its roll, but before the DM determines whether the attack roll or ability check succeeds or fails, or before the creature deals its damage. The creature is immune if it canâ€™t hear you or if itâ€™s immune to being charmed.

import.name: Magical Ambush
import.description: If you target a creature that is unaware of your pressence with a spell, that creature has disadvantage on any saves related to that spell.

import.name: Honed Senses
import.description: After spending some time honing your senses and combining your training with your experience, you are more aware of the world around you. In order for you to be considered Flanked, there must be ${2 + wis,orange}$ creatures around you, scaling with your Wisdom modifier. Additionally, your proficiency modifier now adds to your offhand attacks. You may also spend any number of charges for the below effects: + ${3,orange}$: Reroll a Perception check + ${6,orange}$: Gain your Wisdom modifier (${wis,orange}$) in armor for 1 round + ${10,orange}$: Reroll a Dexterity save or any other save they can arguably have been assisted by your awareness of the world around you.

import.name: Crystalline: Pink
import.description: This creature has an elemental core similar to that of a power crystal, granting it chaotic and unknown abilities.

import.name: Divine Resistance
import.description: You may use a charge to succeed a failed saving throw.

import.name: Chaos Orb
import.description: Use a charge to conjure an orb of arcane energy around you, up to 6 at once. The color of each orb changes at the start of your turn and appears with a random color. For each orb, roll 1d6: 1. Red 2. Yellow 3. Green 4. Cyan 5. Blue 6. Purple The color of the orb imbues various properties that vary by location and effect. As an Action, an orb can be left where you are or thrust up to 10 studs away to sit.

import.name: Magic Immunity
import.description:
You are immune to the effects of magic against you.

Additionally, you have advantage anytime you need to make a save against something caused by magic, such as a magically created ledge on which you might trip.

import.name: Bonded
import.description: You are bonded with another creature and are motivated by their pressence. While your bond is near, you are immune to Fear, and Charm effects.

import.name: Shapechanger
import.description: You are able to take the form of medium or smaller inanimate objects.

import.name: False Appearance
import.description: As long as you hold still, you are indistinguishable from any object of which you have taken. You are still revealed by spells such as Detect Magic or Detect Good and Evil.

import.name: Grappler
import.description: You have advantage on attacks against creatures that you have Grappled.

import.name: Sustained Healing
import.description: When you heal a creature, you may use a charge to leave a healing effect on that creature that continues to heal them for 1d12 per round for ${wis,orange}$ rounds, with the duration scaling with your Wisdom modifier.

import.name: Ruamoka's Touch
import.description: Your chest bears a tattoo of , the symbol of Ruamoka. You feel a sense of power emanating from it whenever you focus on it. As you perform great deeds, you may add charges to this feat and after a successful long rest you may use those charges to manifest the knowledge you have gained as Feats, Spells, or Knowledge. While powerful, there is a limit to how much untapped knowledge you can store. Additionally, the Great Deeds you can perform will certainly change as you learn more of the knowledge within you. See Ruamoka's Power in your Knowledge.

import.name: Charger
import.description: When you use your action to Dash, you can use your Bonus Action to perform an attack with a melee weapon or to shove a creature. If you choose to attack, manage to hit, and moved at least 8 studs in a straight line immediately before making the attack you deal an additional 5 damage. If you choose to shove the target, perform an Athletics skill check against the target's AC and on success push the target up to 8 studs away from you. This push is continued along the direction you were moving.

import.name: Summon Aware
import.description: As long as you have at least ${4,orange}$ summons alive and ${12,orange}$ Wisdom, you can not be considered flanked. Additionally you are aware of minor pressences near your summons, such as if small or larger creatures are near them or general impressions of terrain such as sandy or sunny.

import.name: Keen Mind
import.description: You have a mind that can track time, direction, and detail with uncanny precision. You gain the following benefits: + Increase your Intelligence by ${1,orange}$ + You always know which way is North + You always know how the number of hours left before the next sunrise or sunset + You can accurately recall anything you have seen or heard within the past month

import.name: Linguist
import.description: You have studied languages and codes, gaining the following benefits: + Increase your Intelligence by ${1,orange}$ + You learn three languages of your choice. + You can ably create written ciphers. Others can't decipher a code you create unless you teach them, they succeed on an Intelligence check DC${9 + pro + 2*int,orange}$ (your Intelligence score + your proficiency bonus) or they use magic to decipher it.

import.name: Champion of the Kintari
import.description: A champion of the Kintari, you have gained much experience over the years.

import.name: Ancient Incarnation
import.description:
An ancient spell that has imbued unknown strength and abilities into you.

Additionally this grants you vision to see the soul of creatures, allowing you to see through any illusion or transformation magic to know the true and full nature of any creature you can see.

import.name: Savant of the Kintari
import.description: A champion of the Kintari, you have gained much experience over the years.

import.name: Adaptive Scales
import.description: As a Bonus Action you may expend a change and become Invisible. Your form can not be seen but items being worn or carried remain visible. Performing any Action ends the invisibility.

import.name: Adaptive Claws
import.description: You possess retractable claws, leaving your unarmed strikes to deal no damage. When you Attack you may extend your claws as part of the attack and they have ${dex,orange}$d4 Slashing base damage. With your claw attack you may spend up to ${dex,orange}$ charges to influence the strike adding each point only once to the attack. + 1 Charge: +5 to the Attack Roll. + 3 Charges: Change the damage type to Fire, Cold, Necrotic, or Poison + 5 Charges: Double to the Attack Damage.

import.name: Pocket Dimension Pack
import.description: You have a personalized pocket dimension to store your items, however it is difficult to access. This dimension is not limited by weight but rather by size and can hold 30 Blocks. You have the below additional Actions which require the use of a Charge: + Phase any item into your pocket dimension + Phase any item out of your pocket dimension + Phase all items out of your pocket dimension onto the ground in front of you

import.name: Wild Shape
import.description: You can use your Action and a charge to magically assume the shape of a beast that you have seen before. You regain expended uses when you finish a short or Long Rest. Your druid level determines the Beasts you can transform into, up to a Threat as described below: + Level 2: Threat 0 + Level 4: Threat 1 + Level 8: Threat At 2nd Level, for example, you can transform into any beast that has a Threat of 0 that doesn't have a flying or swimming speed.

import.name: Combat Wild Shape
import.description: You gain the ability to use Wildshape as a Bonus Action and may also use a Bonus Action to expend a charge and regain 1d8 of HP as well.

import.name: Circle Forms
import.description: The rites o your circle grant you the ability to transform into a beast of a Threat rating up to ${2,orange}$ regardless of your Druid level.

import.name: Eyes of the Runekeeper
import.description: You can read all writing.

import.name: Eldritch Sight
import.description: You can cast Detect Magic at will, without expending a spell slot or material components.

import.name: Patron: The Great Old One
import.description: Patron of the Great Old One

import.name: Soul Purge
import.description: You may use a charge with an Action and purge the soul of a recently deceased corpse. The soul may attempt a Wisdom DC${15,orange}$ save to resist if it has more than ${20,orange}$HP. When purged, the corpse disperses, causing Cold and Necrotic damage in a ${8,orange}$ stud radius, each equal to half its Max HP (For a total of its full Max HP). An additional charge may be used to bleed the soul before condeming it, leaving a ${3,orange}$ stud radius pool of Liquid Power Crystal.

import.name: Fury of Lucian
import.description: The laws of the elements bend and aid you. You gain different effects based on what you are standing on: + Clean Ground: You can not be knocked prone. When unconscious, you still remain standing. + Blood: Cold and Necrotic damage instead heal you. + Water: You are immune to Cold damage and gain ${5,orange}$AC and +${5,orange}$ attack. + Liquid Power Crystal: You can the ability to channel or use the power of that crystal. Additionally, you gain additional Actions and Reactions based on your Constitution modifier.

import.name: Fury of Cthulhu
import.description: You have been blessed as an agent of chaos, sowing distrust and destruction. In combat, all of your foes must pass a Constitution DC10 save. For each failed save, you condense an Orb of Power somewhere you can see within ${8,orange}$ studs of you. Once spawned, roll 1d4 to determine the color to which the orb attunes: 1. Red 2. Orange 3. Green 4. Blue These orbs behave according to the arcane spectrum to which they've attuned. Additionally, you gain additional Actions and Reactions based on your Constitution modifier.
